prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.
stories:
A US Army Sergeant, named Black and previously stationed in South Korea, has been detained in Russia, as confirmed by the US military. He was arrested in Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East, on May 2nd, not during an official trip but reportedly to visit a woman he had a romantic relationship with. His mother has confirmed this.

Black, a 34-year-old infantryman who served in Iraq and Afghanistan, was moving duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in Texas. However, instead of returning to the US, he traveled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons. The US Army stated he didn't seek official clearance or authorization for his travel to China or Russia.

The Russian Interior Ministry stated Black was arrested for theft, and he is currently detained in a pre-trial facility. The US Army has been providing consular support to Black, and his family has been notified.

The US National Security Council is aware of Black's case and other matters concerning Russia, but specific details cannot be shared at this time. Russia is also holding two other Americans: Evan Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal reporter detained in March 2023 on espionage charges, and Paul Whelan, a former US Marine accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020. Both men claim their innocence, and the US government regards the charges against them as groundless.

A sergeant from the US Army, identified as Black, who was previously based in South Korea, has been arrested in Russia, as per the confirmation made by the American military. As per his mother's confirmation, Black, aged 34 and hailing from the infantry, was traveling to Vladivostok, located in Russia's Far East, on May 2nd, not for any official purpose but to meet a woman he was in a relationship with.

Black was in the process of relocating from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in Texas when he decided to travel through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, without obtaining official approval or authorization.

The Russian Interior Ministry reported that Black was taken into custody for allegedly committing theft and is currently being held in a pre-trial detention facility. The US Army has been providing necessary consular assistance to Black, and his family has been informed.

The National Security Council of the US is keeping track of Black's situation along with other matters concerning Russia, but specific information cannot be disclosed at this time. Additionally, Russia is currently detaining two other Americans: Evan Gershkovich, a journalist working for the Wall Street Journal, who was arrested in March 2023 on charges of espionage, and Paul Whelan, a former Marine accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020. Both individuals have pleaded not guilty, and the US government has dismissed the accusations against them as baseless.

The U.S. National Security Council is keeping a close eye on this soldier's circumstances as well as other Russia-related matters. At the moment, two more American citizens are being detained in Russia, one of whom is Evan Gershkovich, a journalist for the Wall Street Journal who was taken into custody in March.
